review: Another invitation I should have not bothered to accept. Friends wanted to come here and not knowing another place in Yorba Linda that i wanted to go to off the top of my head I shrugged and went along. Not even wanting to look at the menu, I shared the appetizer platter with a friend. While nothing was disgusting, the quality was just horrendous, the presentation lackluster, no cooking skills required. Service like from a zombie, the whole place just gives off a cheap, artificial vibe. Wait was way too long, prices way too high, should have followed my husbands rule, if they sell the stuff at the grocery store, don't eat it, they are tearing open the same boxes in the kitchen that you get at the store. Pass next time.

First of all, let me say that I'm a regular TGI Friday customer at most of the Friday Restaurants.  But because of one of the Bartender/Server's at this location, I have been coming to this location for at least 20 years now and at least twice a month, if not more.  They have the Best Bartender here by the name of "Izzy".  I don't care how busy it may be, Izzy always provides the "Best" service, has the Best personality, and makes the Best drinks in town.  As a matter of fact, once he sees me, he already knows what drink I like, "Long Island Iced Tea".  I usually bring a lunch guest or two with me.  If all the Servers had his personality and memory, all I can say is WOW, what an asset to TGI Fridays.....

Pretty much one of the only decent places to go is TGI Friday's to get a drink in this area!  My friends and I came out here to celebrate my friends 21st birthday. Place was pretty dead when we got here around 8:45pm.  Sat at the booth in the bar and ordered a couple of drinks.  We were full from our dinner but when you happen to "Check-In" to this place, it states that you can get a free appetizer.  When we showed our server, she said that this deal was only up to $8.  Well they should state that on the yelp thing of course but that was okay, because we were still a bit hungry after our dinner.  We were all craving sweets so each of us got a dessert as well.  We ordered Loaded Skillet Chip Nachos ($9.89)Home-style potato chips with melted cheese and bacon crumbles, stacked in a skillet and smothered in white cheddar queso. Garnished with more bacon crumbles and green onions.  Hmmmm sounded good but it was just way too salty!!  Made me want to have a heart attack!  This thing was super heavy and made me feel sick after a couple of bites. Brownie Obsession ($5.99) A warm brownie made with Ghirardelli® chocolate-fudge sauce. Topped with vanilla ice cream, caramel and pecans. So good and fudgey!!  Love the ice cream on top and definitely love the combination of hot and cold!  Very rich brownie as well! Tennessee Whiskey Cake: A warm toffee cake topped with glazed pecans and vanilla ice cream. Served with butterscotch Jack Daniel's® Whiskey sauce.  Very moist and rich as well!  LOVE IT! Washington Apple martini ($7.99)-  Love it!  Super strong! Atmosphere is a very older crowd, well compared to us.  Some people were playing poker on the TV screens as well.  I guess this is not a terrible place to come to considering there is nothing in this area.   NOTE: -Clean bathrooms -Check-In on Yelp for a free appetizer (up to $8) -Happy hour!!

My girlfriend ordered the tiramisu martini and it was very short, about an inch and a half short. I told the waiter to mention it to the bartender. She came over to the bar where we could hear her And she told the waiter "it's not short, that's how it is". So too bad for us I guess. That's customer service I can do without.

Horrible every time.  Came here for my birthday with the whole family... including girlfriends and my granddaughter, plus a few friends. We were like 15 all in all.  My food had to be sent back 3 times because it was not right, and when I got it the 4th time it still was not right, but I ate it anyway.  My youngest son, 18, who doesn't speak up, never got his burger... everyone was practically done before anyone realised that he wasn't eating.  The manager came around and comp'd the 2 meals. This was not the first time we had a bad experience at this location...

When I came to write this review I was actually surprised to find only 2.5 stars. I thought we just had a bad experience, but after reading other reviews I can see the management clearly doesn't care.  If I could give zero stars I would.  When we first walked in the host was rude. That should have been our first indication to leave. After we got sat, it took over twenty minutes for our server to get our drink orders. We both ordered boneless wings. One order was cold as one was mediocre at best. After another twenty minutes we flagged down a server to order another round, hoping these would be better. We were wrong again. We decided to change the flavor because the first round wasn't good.  The second round was worse than the first. Everything was practically tasteless.  At this point, we had been there for over an hour. We couldn't find our server again so we flagged down another one to request our check. We waited 15 more minutes and still no check. Finally our server come by and we ask him for the check. He said he would get it, and we waited another 15 minutes. He returned without the check!!! We said we really have to go and need our check. We got the bill and it had our $20, and $80 in other charges. At the bottom of the check the $80 was removed and we were left with the actual charges. To think they think that was worth 100 dollars is absolutely absurd.  This was the worst restaurant experience I have ever encountered in my life. Needless to say, we will never be returning. If this place wants to stay in business, they have a lot of work to do, starting with customer service.

Writing this review as my food gets cold cause it was brought to my table first while we wait for the other 4 plates for my family......I should have known this was going to be a crappy experience since the waitress was lacking a personality and took our order as if she was being inconvenienced by our presence. I got the Friday's shrimp, i think McDonald's might offer better food and service, though I hate their food and haven't been there in years, this is a horrible "restaurant" I wouldn't call it a restaurant.......

With the shortage of free time I have I love my date nites... Then to visit this TGI Fridays and not be offered refills, served raw potatoes, cold chicken, a dry skillet. Not to mention never even have a manager check in with us after we told the waitress our food was not edible. We will not come back, maybe you need to be drunk to think this food was worth paying for.

Worst service ever. Never coming back here again. First got seated, then waited 30 minutes for some random person to take our drink order. Our waitress Mayra, who we just then met, came over with 4 drinks even though we ordered 3. She mistakenly gave me an alcoholic drink even though I'm only 18. After all this frustration, we asked 5 people for the manager, David, and after 10 minutes he finally showed up. He discounted our appetizers. He was very kind, but the waitress continued to be extremely rude, slow, and gave us dirty looks all night after we spoke to the manager.

Our afternoon at Friday's started off Meh and ended up A-OK. This place was quiet on a Monday and we sat in the bar area, planning to get our grub on with some appetizers (HALF PRICE). It took twelve minutes for anyone to come and take our order after the host left us. Eventually a server came by and said she'd get our order started on behalf of the bartender who'd be taking care of us. We saw this bartender at our table exactly one time - after our food had arrived. She asked if we were okay. At that point we were - we had our food. The food was actually pretty good! The service - not so much. They took care of us but nothing about this trip made me think, "Gosh, I can't wait to come back here!"

I don't get why the service is so slow and so bad if we're always the only table here. I also don't know why we keep coming back. My husband and kids are halfway done with their food and the rest of us are sitting here waiting for our food. Took forever to order our food, took even longer to get our appetizer, and even longer to actually get our drinks. Hope I don't make the mistake of coming back here.

Absolutely Horrible service and rude employees- especially for Yorba Linda. My family and I sat at a table in the bar area and flashed the server light via their tablet. 10 minutes later, still no one and at least 5 employees passed us. When we asked someone who are server was for the area, they had no idea.  WORST PART- My dad mentioned to the front about how he was disappointed on the lack of service. When I walked out a couple steps behind him, the 2 male hostesses at the front talked about us saying how we essentially had no right to complain since we just there. If you are going to talk sh*t about your (potential) customers, do so AFTER we leave.

The food was really tasty, but the service killed it for me. The person who waited on us was rude and acted like she did not want to be there. Also, they seemed severely understaffed. Took a good 20-30 minutes just to get our food. Had to flag down the waitress several times just to get our check and pay. Did not check up on us or check refills.

My friends and I have come here pretty frequently considering how close it is to all of us. Every time the service has gotten worse and worse. I really don't like making bad reviews but I feel if this place wants to stay in business, it needs to straighten up a bit. Every single time we have come, there always seems to be some adjustment made to the endless appetizers which we always get. it's supposed to be like 10 bucks or something, but they always come back with the bill saying we shared or got the "premium" appetizers when we didn't. $10? No, no. More like a $24 dollar bill. For appetizers microwaved in the back and take 20 minutes to come out to you each time which they consider premium, keep in mind. Last time we went there was kind of the final straw. The waitress started off by giving us all the stink eye when we mentioned we wanted the bill split prior to ordering. Just so we could save the trouble, you know? She looked at us like we were dumb. That was pretty rude, first of all. Service was slow as hell throughout the whole time we were there. She comes back with our bills not split like we asked. We correct her, she finally splits it. Due to our previous experience in getting overcharged for apparently ordering premium appetizers, we were sure not to do that. The bill said we did and we argued that we didn't. Our waitress argued that she has it written down that that is what we ordered. Okay? She could have written anything on that piece of paper. Just because she misheard us doesn't mean we ordered premium appetizers.  We are fed up, we pay and leave. Friend goes back in because he forgot his debit card. Oh weird, she doesn't seem to know where it went. We follow them around, talk to the manager and wait around for 15 minutes. Lo and behold, there's the card that she "found on the ground."  I understand food industry is hard. I've been in it. But when you're rude from beginning to end, and can't even practice simple work ethics, then you don't deserve to be in this business. Straighten up your employee's TGI Friday's.

To management, I really want take a moment of your time and recognize Izzy Pareo the bartender at Friday's next to Best Buy in the Savi Rancho center. He is a truly extraordinary person with really amazing service. Management, this is only really scratching the service of his dedication to his customers.  His interpersonal skills as a bartender is awesome and he is a really Kool human being.  He helps me figure out what I'm in the mood for lunch/dinner/happy hour or whatever.  Lord let me tell you that I'm like every other American and my taste for food and drinks changes.  He needs promotion and a raise what he brings to the table. Keep a eye out for him

So bummed to have to give a bad review. Maybe it is nostalgia kickin in but wow the quality of the food was below par. Skinniest Chicken wings ever and this is from the place that used to be THE PLACE to get them. The Chicken Cobb salad was no larger than a side salad with a dry chicken breast thrown on top. Sadly, the time my family will be visiting a Fridays.
Nice place. People who work there are cool. Cheap beer and mozzarella sticks lol

Seriously this has to be the worst service I've ever had. I've been sitting in a bar booth, in a semi empty restaurant for the last 50 min, board out of my mind. My food is not here yet, my drink was weak, and the waitress has a crappy attitude. I'd walk out if I wasn't starving. 10 min latter. My food is here now, and apparently the chief can not read in English. I specifically asked for no bell pepper in my cajun chicken & shrimp pasta, and it has bell pepper. I m still waiting for a water, and my wife's vegetable melody is pure Broccoli. I normally don't take the time to write a review while I'm in the middle of my lunch, but the TGI Fridays in Yorba Linda SUCKS! I will avoid this location in the future.

The bar staff are ALWAYS rude here and act as if they inconvenienced by your patronage. They are short, coarse, and seemingly bothered by having to attend to your needs. Perhaps the mounting number of similar reviews will precipitate a change in the staff or their attitudes. If you are looking for smiles and service, do yourself a favor and have a real happy hour somewhere else.

SLOW SERVICE!! Endless Appetizer Deal Not Worth It!!! I came with a party of 5 and ordered the Endless Appetizers deal for$10 for myself. It took Forever to bring out the next appetizer. I put in the order for the second appetizer as soon as I got my first one (no one ends with just 1). The waitress said she put the order in but it wasn't until another 20 minutes after I finished my 1st plate that I received it. By the time I finished my 2nd appetizer everyone else in my party was wrapping up.... So I didn't get enough to really make it a deal because the service is so slow...
Review for Sunday:   NFL - open at 10am 15 Tv's - great happy hour prices ($2 beers) and food ... bottomless Bloodys and a friendly bar staff.  This is the go to place in the area for football!!!

I had the privilege, of dining at TGIF's, Friday night. I had been to this location a few times before, but it had been maybe 2 years since I last visited.  Parking is always great, since it's park of a large shopping center. In fact, if you're a window shopper, you could spend all day, checking out store after store!  The exterior is always landscaped well, colorful, clean, and inviting.  Upon entering, two hostesses were there, to greet me. I find that crucial, as I dine out often and like to feel welcomed and valued, as a paying customer. I was sat in Lauren's section. She acknowledged me, within a reasonable time frame, and started drink orders immediately.  I love this menu. It's colorful, organized, expansive, has assorted photos, AND LISTS CALORIE COUNTS!  I loved that I had several choices, at creating a healthy dinner option, that could keep me under 500 calories! I could even sample an appetizer (up to $8 free, with a Yelp check-in) and add a beer (Michelob Ultra) and still feel great about my plan to control what I eat.  The tables have the ziosk, which is now a hit with families. We briefly played Millionaire Monopoly, but it's another way to keep kids entertained (and patient) if need be.  The food all tasted delicious, was reasonable in portion size, and came out at the right temperature. Overall, we really enjoyed our experience and will return relatively soon.

I will not come here again unless we get a gift card O_o.  A gift card that was gifted by our friend was the only reason why we came. We didn't wanna waste it, so we thought why not give it a try again. And I say again because the last time we went to TGI Fridays (Torrance) it was just awful.  Unfortunately, this location was just as awful. Customer service was okay, but the food sucks! Food looked much better in the menu with vibrant photos.   We had... -JACK SLIDERS  $9- I appreciate the huge portion, but the patty was a tough.  -PECAN CRUSTED CHICKEN SALAD -$11 Chicken was barely warm and tasted like it was microwaved. But I did like the lightly dressed greens with balsamic vinaigrette, pecans, mandarin oranges and blue cheese. -FISH and CHIPS - Don't get it! I warned El Hubby not to get it, but he didn't listen, so he regretted it. It was too salty!!!! Yuck! -MARGARITA- The bartender said "here's your iced margarita" lol. El Hubby got it in blended and he said it was a tad bit too sweet.  We came around 8:15pm on a week night. We were seated by the bar area because the dining area was closed. I say this place is good for Happy Hour, but if you want good food go to Keno's!!!

This place has gone downhill.  Maybe it was an off night, but my wife and I had to wait more than a half hour for our food to arrive tonight.  And when it did arrive, I'm not even sure we received the right food as my wife's flat iron looked more like a top sirloin and was pretty bloody for what was supposed to be a medium.  And to top it all off, some folks who arrived and ordered 10 minutes after we did got their food first, which would have been forgiveable had they not ordered nearly identical meals. The food was not as good as we've had on prior visits.  The rice pilaf I ordered was just some white rice with little seasoning.  My steak was full of gristle and more cooked than a medium steak should be.  The Mac and cheese was the shining spot and really saved the meal, that gooey cheese innards with panko topping really is a killer combo. I felt bad for the waitress.  She had to discount another table's bill because apparently this was a systematic thing.  I really am hoping this was an off night.

Over priced crap in my opinion. I don't think the food is event remotely worth what they priced it at. Complete waste of money. $12 for a few scraps of chicken? Seriously? This is far from a 2 star restaurant, I would probably have preferred Denny's to be honest.  The service sucks. Waitress stops by very sparingly. She only refilled 2 of the 4 water glasses at our table. Can you guess which glasses she filled? The 2 closest to her.  The spinach dip didn't taste very good. And the amount we got isn't worth $10 in my opinion. Nothing here is priced properly to be honest, I regret going here, everything on the menu should be at least $3 cheaper to better reflect the value.  No napkins at our table. No silverware. Food came out slow. Really a horrible experience. Would never come back again!

Ok,   I'm back here in October 2016. And I have to say the bartender / server John really rocks!!!  Came in last night for dinner and just had excellent tonight and service and darn good food, John was our server. Came back tonight dirty and tired after a day helping our kids move out to Riverside and while the service on the floor during rush hour wasn't that good,  John was behind the bar!  I was able to find him,  get help getting a few drinks and I mean the guy just delivers the product!!  Absolutely excellent service from this guy!!  I will keep coming back because I like giving a great tip to a great guy!

Our server today was Mario, He was spot on!  Food was very good, ty4 another great lunch!!  Old reviews..,,,,, I've been here many times, it's a favorite "I don't want to cook" location for me. I can get healthy, filling good food in a happy comfortable location with friendly people.  Last night I had the Strawberry Fields salad. It was so good with more strawberry than I could eat, my husband helped me out with that! I also got a 9oz wine, I love that option. 3 regular glasses tend to be too much for me, the one 9oz is perfect and only 2$ more than the 6oz. Our server was Edgar, he is a very good server. He was attentive and helpful and prompt,  we never had to look for him.  We sat at a bar table last night and my husband got to watch the sports.  The bar area is very nice, I prefer it to a booth in the dining area.  I believe it is the energy in there, it feels good.  Over the last 10 years I've been frequenting here, when there has been a minor issue, the management is quick to rectify the situation and make things right.  No business can be perfect all the time, humans work there!  I recommend this restaurant highly,
The food here is decent. Iced tea glasses are old and hard water spotted. They're gross to drink from.
We had a family gathering of 20 people. The Food was good but the service was slow. Due to being short staffed.

Very slow service, waited 20 minutes for drinks, and there was only one other couple in the place at 11:15 this morning. Food was over cooked. I have seen Jason S., the manager, apologizing for the terrible service here for at least 3 months, why is he still the manager? No offense, but can you not clean house if you've had 30 bad reviews in the past 6 months?

We came for lunch and the service was great! Reece was our server, and he was very attentive to us.  Our food came out quickly and drinks were refilled. I had the flatiron steak and asked for it medium and it was cooked perfectly! I liked that the fruit that came with my daughter's meal wasn't full of just fruit. It was a good selection of strawberries, pineapples, and mandarin oranges. My husband ordered a cheeseburger, but he wasn't that impressed, which is why it wasn't a full 5 stars.

Service has improved and I'm just sad this place is closing down. The raspberry basil margaritas are the best! Also sine my last visit, the manager did apologize for the not so great service. All is forgiven.

I love TGIF. Their food may not be the best quality, but hey, it tastes good. I only come for the endless appetizers, which is $10 or $12 per person. Potato skins are my favorite, haven't found them anywhere else as good as here. Crispy green bean fries - also delicious. Boneless buffalo chicken wings - good stuff. Sesame jack chicken strips - A1.  Also, happy hour is half off appetizers if you don't want to do the endless menu!

I've been coming here for around 14 years now and it's convenient consistent and most importantly the beer is always ice cold so I will continue to go there. But I'm writing this review to help people. DO NOT ORDER the mahi mahi flatbread nanwich. It's straight up horrible. It's got 2 tiny pieces of fish inside which stank so i know it wasnt super fresh and to top it off the fish had spines in it. I pulled out two large ones as they smashed into the roof of my mouth. The veggies in it were good but pretty much one of the worst fish anythings I've ever eaten and I'm Korean and we eat rotten fish. It's my fault, I should've just stuck with the things i know and like but yeah avoid this dish at all costs. Or ask for lemons win it. Like 4 wedges.

Well the restaurant is run down a bit the food is not the best but the staff is great and the happy hour deals were the best in town for sports nights. Mario was the best server I have ever had at any restaurant I have been to. I will be sad to see this place close in the beginning of March.

Ordered  Loaded potato skins, Friday's shrimp & Jack Daniel's burger. Loaded potato skins ($9.29): potato skin with chopped  bacon, served with sour cream and chives. Thick potato skins!! I wish they were a little thinner, but the bacon was a nice touch. Friday's shrimp ($15.29): a dozen of fried shrimps, served with fries and cocktail sauce. Not the best shrimps, but not too bad.  Jack Daniel's burger ($11.49): the sauce was kinda good. QUICK  TIP: FREE APPETIZER  UP TO $8.00 WITH CHECK IN!! 3 stars!! TGIF is almost  yummylicious!!

We arrived right before the night rush tonight, ordered a round of beers, and endless apps in the bar area. Unfortunately, we had to talk to the manager because we were about an hour in and our apps never came out. Our server never checked up on us to at least let us know why they were taking so long, we had to ask him. I work for a restaurant so I understand it's a Friday night and it gets busy but if you need help starting your tables or running food to your tables ASK so your guests don't have too.

I love the Friday's menu, but the service here is so bad - it's not worth it.  After one of three hostesses sat us at a table, we waited 10 minutes for anyone to acknowledge us.  Of course, several employees walked past our table without saying anything or ask if we needed any help.  As we contemplated leaving - we were finally graced with the presence of a waitress to place our drink order.  Since we had read the menu cover to cover a thousand times - we were ready to order food as well.  After about five minutes, we finally got our drinks (Draft beers - not difficult).  About 30 seconds later, our food arrived.  After digging in, we figured out we had no napkins, waited a few minutes - then decided to just steal napkins from the table across from us.  Never saw the waitress again until the check arrived.   The restaurant was not crowded and plenty of employees standing around (Three hostesses at the entrance).  They need to work better as a team and help each other out.  I will drive to the Friday's at the Block from now on.... This was the third negative experience at the Friday's in the past month.  Three strikes - you're out!!!

I love this place!!!! JOHN at the bar is amazing and always takes care of us. Their happy hour is great and it keeps me and my fiancé coming back! Definitely recommend for people coming here for their HH.

Horrible. We were passing through the area for a night out and stopped here on a whim and as soon as we walked in you could tell it's not a popular place, we were hoping it was because we were early but when we received very poor service, the wrong order, and absolutely tasteless and over cooked food we knew exactly why this restaurant was empty on a Saturday night. Even the alcoholic mixed drinks were awful, it was as if this restaurants management has no desire to keep the business open. If you don't mind being ignored and you don't have tastebuds this is your spot.

If i could rate this place with a 0 star i would. Took them almost 1hr and 30 min to get my food. We got seperate checks and they still managed to fuck up the checks! Never coming back again.. HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!

I've never had a bad experience at a TGIFs so I didn't think to look at reviews before I came here but I should've. I ordered the sizzling chicken plate & the chicken was over cooked & I could clearly see the square of American cheese they laid under it, didn't bother to melt it all the way I guess. The service was just as bad. Never got a refill, food took long to come out even though it wasn't busy. When I gave the waitress a tip she counted it in front of me lol and then turned to her coworker. I've had such good food & service at the Brea location, I will definitely never be coming back here.
Food is excellent, but the COSTUMER SERVICE SUCKS! Waited for approximately 2 hours for our food, and at the end of the night the hole check was screwed up! Ugh worse experience ever...
Wow the bartender named Micaela is such a doll! Great drinks! Great times! Great fun!

I will just get straight to the point! I came here after my Coachella trip late in the evening on a Sunday. It was not full so I figured that service would be quick. The waitress arrived and took the order. My foodie date ordered the spinach and artichoke dip as an appetizer for us both. As for the entrees, we both opted for burgers. Now, I was under the impression that the appetizer came first before the entrée. On this visit, it was the exact opposite! Burgers first, then the artichoke dip afterwards! I then attempted to ask the waitress of the issue. Apparently, she had forgotten to place our appetizer on the bill! Uh oh! I did not get upset. I was just kinda surprised! As for the food, the burgers were amazing. I usually opt for the Jack Daniels burger. My foodie date had the same. Amazing I say! It literally was empty. Wow! Maybe it was due to the area where it was located! It is in a big area that looks secluded at first. Honestly, I chose this place because I happened to see the sign off the 91 freeway coming home.  Our waitress was very apologetic with the situation and for that, I cannot say or leave such negativity on a review. Maybe I just came on a not so good day. But however, I am not going to bash the business. I probably will come back...if I am ever in the area! Hey, I just cannot get enough of them loaded potato skins!

People are right.  It was super slow here and service took foreverrrrrrrrr    Staff was nice so I won't be too negative about them but common... I only saw a few other tables occupied and plenty of employees standing around.  (Basically, it was not ANYWHERE near busy).  All in all, it took 15-20 minutes to get 2 drinks, and another 20-30 for food.  Waitress didnt check on us once during our entire time there that I can recall Management.  Are you reading this? Online reviews can negatively affect your business.

I went with my family for ribs after waiting for 1/2 hour to seat they told us they don't have it. We try to order appetizers they said you can't because we don't have ribs even when I said it's ok with chicken wings they said no we can't.  Also, we order Steak and for $24 it was extremely bad. Never go to that place again. Believe me for the price you paying you can go to much better restaurant 0 of 5 if I could.

Seriously tgi fridays? My boyfriend and I have always been fans of this restaurant but the past 5 times have been the worst experiences. Waited an hour and a half for 2 appetizers, waiters never check up on us, have to ask multiple times for items. Basically poorly managed and cruddy service.  I'm done with this place.

30 minutes has elapsed and finally the drinks arrive, no exaggeration. I know to not expect much from a chain restaurant but dam at least try a bit won't yq? When the food did come out the well done wings I asked for came back a bit bloody! Even when I tried to prevent this mistake ot still occurred. Slow staff that really gives a half a fuck about this place. But I blame management for this since they allow this crappy service to exist. All in all wrong soft drinks, undercooked chicken and to top it off she took my plate while I was still munching on fries. God I really feel like I wasted an hour of my life here. I'd expect this crap at Denny's. I won't come back.

I went there last night and had a burger, it the the worst burger I've ever had.  The french frys were all dried up and I bet they were sitting all day.  I had to send a margarita back, awful.  The glass of wine I changed it for was awful.  I can see why they are closing down.
I love Alex, she's the best bartender!! So personable, and she was attentive to everything I needed. Lover her. I'll be back.

If there was a no star button , I would of push that! Service was terrible slow had to always ask for drinks also unwilling to give good service and his overall poor service even the cook had to come and bring us our plate that's how bad it was!

This was the worst Fridays I've ever been to. My husband and I had to reorder our steaks TWICE. Even after the second time, they still were not medium rare. I'm not sure who the cooks are, but I highly suggest that the manager does some new hiring. The manager offered to take 20% off of our bill, which I kindly declined and let him that I would not be paying for my meal at all. I didn't even eat it. We will never be returning to this incompetent restaurant with its incompetent staff ever again. The ONLY reason they're getting two stars from me is because the waitress was a doll. Thank you Crystal!

Let me start off by saying the service was fine. I had a chicken cob salad the tomato were rotten shriveled and did not taste good at all. Every piece of chicken had gristle and no flavor. They use the lowest grade of meat and hope you don't notice what a horrible cut of meat it is. And I've never had a cob salad without avocado when we ask them about the missing avocado we got the dumbest look I have ever seen on someone's face. Trying to save face she said oh were out of avocado after we got our meal. My wife and I use to come here for dinner. This place has gone downhill real bad. Stay away!!!!!!

Working on Thanksgiving day is a sacrifice. And for those of us looking for an open restaurant after traveling for 5 hours, a welcome one.  Thank you Tyler for your quality of service! You were professional, personal and pleasant. Hats off to you!

This place has terrible service! I work in guest service and I know how important it is to attend to guests and ensure that they leave happen each and every time. Me and my boyfriend decided to come here for a nice dinner out and we sat at our table for 20 minutes with no attendance from any sever. No one to ask if we would like drinks or even greet us! Finally we got sick of waiting and got up and left. Not to mention there was only about 15 people inside the restaurant at this time, therefore there should be no reason for the lack of attention we received. Will not be returning to this location! Don't waste your time, drive down the road to chili's where service is better and prices are cheaper!

What a disappointment... The restaurant was dirty and we even witnessed servers and bussers throwing trash on the ground  Our server was not friendly, abrupt and didn't give a damn about anything except the couple on the patio vaping and playing with their dog!!  Just moved to east Yl  We will NOT eat here again  If we want TGIF we will go to Brea

If I could give them a lower rating I would. Hubby and I went there last night, what a mistake!! I had the salmon w/langostinos. This dish was awful, about a half a teaspoon of Alfredo Sauce and no mushrooms in sight. It was the most flavorless salmon I've ever had. I ordered a loaded baked potato as a side, the first bite was so horrible I asked for mashed potatoes instead, when I saw the bill they had the nerve to charge us $3.00 for the substitute!  Ah but it gets better....later,after I was home a while I became violently ill OMG. Really ill. I will NEVER go back to this Friday's. All I can say is STAY AWAY.

Ok. I need people to temper their expectations about TGI Friday's. You don't go here for an amazing culinary experience, you go for some cheap deep fried happy hour stuff and some equally cheap happy hour drinks. Understand? What I like about TGI Friday's is that the happy hour menu and prices works. I hate going places and happy hour is $1 off pizza, $3 domestic beers (that's how much they should be anyway), and $4 well cocktails. No, friends. TGI Friday's happy hour menu provides enough options to enjoy your post work shenanigans. Unless you're a crazy health nut person, but if that's the case you shouldn't be here anyway. Go find a Souplantation or somethin'. Anyway, is it my first choice? Nah. I'll only go if someone else mentions it. But it's somewhere that I can make work.
I got food poisoning here last night. The lighing was also quite strange. It was so bright that it felt like eating in a cafeteria.

Worst Fridays ever. Went in earlier this afternoon with my mom at 1:35pm. Stood at hostess station. Not too busy. Bartender conversing with a customer the whole time. One waitress came out to help a party of 10 briefly then disappeared. Another waiter helped a small booth near the bar then disappeared. Not like they were busy. No acknowledgement. Stood there for 10 minutes. Unacceptable! So we left. and never coming back!

This was our 2nd or 3rd time here, but it doesn't matter really... Our server was nice and she was pleasant.  She was quick and very attentive, so that was good.  Food on the other hand, was really just ok... My bruscetta chicken really lacked flavor.. it was just bland, and it seemed like they cheaped out on the sauce.. since there was barely any on the pasta... Husband seemed to like his steak, but he said his potato tasted kinda weird... like the texture was off...  But anyhow, it was ok, nothing special...

Poor service, entree was served before appetizer. Had to ask for it! Fries were soggy and cold. Had to ask for refills, box and check. Nice server but she just wasn't on her game and MIA most of our dinner. Additionally, the crayons are cheap and with a 2 yr old no one offered a booster. We did everything but make the food.

Would have been two stars but my food was good...it is two now see bottom note First we got there and waited about 5 minutes before the host even noticed us. Then she still didn't seat us so a busser or server said I'm not good at this but I'll seat you. Where does he sit us? Right next to screaming kids even though the place is empty...loss of one star here Then after seated it takes another ten minutes for our server to come to us. I am assuming this is because we are in a back corner with the screaming kids....loss of one star here  The food came after another long wait. We even got our food at the same time that we got out free appetizer for checking in...would have been a loss of a star but the food tasted good! We got chicken piccata pasta and Fridays shrimp. Even as I draft this review we have been done eating for 10 minutes and have yet to have our table cleared and our check delivered! We got our check delivered after over 15 minutes and when I promptly gave the server my card he ran it and returned and put the check down...I grab it to to put a tip and sign yet he had not left me a pen. My fiancée had to get up and go ask another server for a pen just sober could get out of there!

I love this place! Great food and very fast, organized service. Our server, Samantha, was just a doll and got us everything we needed without even asking. I needed a drink refill and before calling her over, she basically read my mind and come over with my drink in her hand. Amazing customer service and great food! I was very surprised at how busy it was and all of the servers kept it together and we're very organized.

Foods always good. Love that they know us so well, they just bring us our drinks. Great staff, they work hard and are super friendly. Always make time to stop and say hello. Thanks Fridays for helping me relax after a long days work!

Ironically, coming here on a Friday night at around 9 in Yorba Linda is still pretty busy. Our server was super chill. We originally came here to use the buy 1, get one free entree coupon, and wanted to get away with 2 of them, but he said that they may or may not, since they're getting more strict about it, but their manager agreed, and let us do it. I'm not sure how the Jack Daniel ribs came out, as my parents got it, but I got the 3 for $20 deal.  Their mozzarella sticks were typical, nothing usual, but the marinara sauce was STONE COLD. It was very hard and not appetizing. Even the warmth of the mozzarella sticks couldn't do anything.... I got the petite sirloin, it was nothing special. The meat lacked flavor, but TGIF isn't known for their steaks. The only good thing on my plate was the stuffed mashed potatoes, which had flavor.  My sister got the fried shrimp and fries, which was pretty cold. I don't think she liked it. The shrimp could have been crisper, it was more moist and soft to the touch. The fries, where to begin. I don't think they should have been called fries.... The dessert was alright. We got the vanilla bean cheesecake with chocolate sauce drizzled all over.  I think the only good thing about TGIF is the low price during happy hour and the 3 course meal for 2, if you're on a budget. Otherwise, go elsewhere for better food. Service was amazing though!

i barely come here but im glad they still have their 3 courses for 2 people! flatbread appetizer was delicious! its like a cross between a flatbread with spinach dip :) it was slightly crispy which i liked. i also loove the string beans here i forgot what my sis' dish was called but it was pasta w/ grilled chicken. i actually thought this was pretty good. the hint of balsamic really made it stand out petite sirloin: eh just average. kinda reminds me of something you could get at Dennys or Norms. for dessert i tried the brownie obsession  and this DEFINITELY satisfied my sweet tooth cravings.  the brownie was soo rich and was even better w/ that scoop of icecream on the top. mm! i sat in the bar area on a friday night and service was okay. the table wasnt wiped down and was a little bit greasy but not a huge problem

I remember TGIFridays being so much cooler when I was in High School...now it's on about the same level as a Dennys but with more modern decor and slightly better looking staff.  We came in for happy hour, so luckily the prices were great because the food was only so-so and the service was pretty terrible. Luckily the beers were ice cold, which kept me pacified while waiting for the bartender to take our order, and quite frankly waiting for the her to do anything.  Definitely won't be coming back here, there are plenty of other chains in the area with far better food & service.

Fridays is a fun place to go watch sports games (NFL football) and enjoy the happy hour that is offered all day on Sunday.  The only thing I can say bad about the Yorba Linda location is that it is often cold in the bar area so girls bring a sweater on not..LOL.

OK, I've come to understand that when you get bad service in a restaurant, only a portion of the blame can be directed at the server. After all, servers are generally only going to do as well as they've been trained to do. And when things go wrong, as some things apparently did on this visit, how they handle that will again be based on what they've been trained to do when things go wrong. That said, here's how my visit this evening went: I went in as a solo diner; the place was about half-full. I sat for at least 10 minutes, maybe closer to 15, before my server appeared to take my order. I expected my salad to come out soon after that, but 20 minutes later it hadn't arrived. My entree came out, but not my salad. I finished my entree completely, and still no salad. After waiting for probably another 10 minutes, I finally stopped my server as he went by and asked if I'd be getting my salad any time soon. He apologized, made a comment about problems in the kitchen (which I heard him mention to other customers), and went back to the kitchen. A few minutes later he re-appeared with my salad, which I'd ordered now nearly 45 minutes earlier.  I finished eating, paid my bill, and then found that I'd been shorted on my change. I was shorted only 34 cents so I wasn't going to make an issue of it. By that time I just wanted to leave and get home. Oh, yeah; the food was adequate. Not great, but not awful.

Use to come Sunday for happy hours after girls volleyball games, it was okay and good value. Came in yesterday for lunch, the chicken on the salad was so dry. I though it was a fossil. Service was okay.

Just a disappointment ...... The food was below  average. I will say the server tried but just came up short. Prior to ordering the French Dip inquired if they have available straight horseradish and was told yes. They brought me a small cup of sauerkraut and was told that's all they have. Requested from the waiter and front desk a toothpick and was told they never have them!! Poorly managed and will go to other restaurants in the area.

First off there is no more kids eat free on Tuesdays. The kids hamburger for $5 is just meat and bun nothing else. I got the Parmesan crusted chicken meal for 2 we each got the chicken. My moms was fine but I guess they thought I ordered octopus or clam sushi because it was like I was eating a rubber tire. This made me remember why I only come here for happy hour apps and drinks. Manager took it off bill but I went home hungry because I didnt eat that parmesan crusted rubber tire. Server was trying way too hard.. he was so nice it was annoying. Plus we overheard another server apologize saying "im sorry" literally 6 times to another table. The manager was just giving us lip service....first time in at least 5 years not going for happy hour and prob the last in general....but I will go to the new not rundown and dirty fridays in brea...

Again, strawberry margaritas! $5 happy hour, fairly large, taste like candy. Place seems slower than its Brea location but that's not always a bad thing. Service is usually just OK but went yesterday (Monday) and Ernie was awesome. Made conversation with us, joked around, great guy. ++ ! Made a point to take a polaroid with him for fun.  Toasted Almonds are made well here.  Georgia Peach Iced tea was pretty good, something bitter (maybe the rum or the cranberry) but that's just my opinion on the ingredients, it was made well.

I recommend you go somewhere else. The hosts eat at their station, right at the front for all guests to see when they walk in. The food runner tried to pass off my chicken dish as "salmon" and I was told "its the same thing". The meals for my guest and I were both cold. Almost anything tastes good when you're starving, but not this time. The server was a good guy but that's the only positive on this visit.

This is one of my regular local places to go.  Me and my family normally have food and drinks in the bar area. The servers are always friendly.  There is lots to choose from on their menu.  My favorite day to come here is Sunday to watch football and get some food.

This is the WORST place I've EVER been to in my life. My dog gets food better than the food served here. I ordered the petite sirloin which is described as follows "Petite Sirloin This mouth-watering 6-ounce filet-style cut of tender black Angus sirloin is fire-grilled, topped with maison butter and served with your choice of two sides" NO SIR. my steak was NOT "fire-grilled" it was microwaved. I asked for medium rare, and got a well done, microwaved grey piece of steak. With broccoli that was overcooked with a lovely shade of baby vomit green and not a spot of salt to be seen.  Never coming back. EVER.

Disapointing service, however surprisingly good fare!  So I will start off with the good.   I ordered the Cobb Salad (only Dinner item around 500 cal) which can easily be screwed up if not made right and my Husband ordered the Peppered Pork Chop that was a little over cooked.  But when it comes to the pigs I think being safer than sorry is best, I guess.  Given that it was 11:20p at night, it was delicious!  We were surprised because The service sucked! Now with the bad.  We arrived to the practically empty restaurant around 10:20p.  We were quickly greeted and seated.  Under our clean booth table (?) was a pile of napkins and a straw on the floor.  Ok, I brushed it over with my feet.  Our Waiter immediately took our order for drinks, wine and beer.  He never came back to our table until about 15 minutes later.  When he did, he advised that they were out of my wine and that the bartender was checking.  In the corner of his eye, he then realized she found more. Okay, so drinks should be on their way.   It took another 15 minutes!  Why?  Thank God we ordered our food at the time he was at our table.  It's now approx. 10:50p and we ordered our food 15 min. Before.  Dinner did not arrive until 11:18p.   If it was not for the fact we were just thankful to have a first night out after having our third child, and that a restaurant was even open this late; we may have not been so tolerant!  Regardless, unacceptable service and I will be complaining to corporate.

With a party of 3 on a Saturday afternoon around 3:45, we had no idea we'd have to wait 50 minutes. It wasnt even busy! Our waiter did a decent job but he never said what the hold up was. We should've just got up and left and went to Wahoo's.

HORRIBLE SERVCE! Today I went there and was waiting more than 5 mins to get service. No water, no soda and no waitress. No customers either, know wondner why! This is the second time in 2 weeks and now after walking out. I will never go to this location ever. EVER! Save your money and time. It happened twice to me and it will happen to you.

I came with my family for dinner to this location due to it being closer to home..... What a disappointment!!! I should have looked at reviews before I did! I would have driven to Rancho Cucamonga's location at Victoria Gardens instead!!!! The ONLY good thing was our waitress! She very sweet!!!! However.... The food was horrible! We ordered the Bourbon Mahi Mahi.... It was drier than dry and looked NOTHING like the picture on menu, the food took forever only to find out they ran out of one of our sides!!!! It wasn't even busy!!! My dad ordered a soup and it arrived after his meal!!!!!!! It wasn't a cheap meal but would have felt more satisfied eating at Carl's Jr! It was that bad! My parents told me the next day they ate something before bed because they were still hungry! Awful, awful and just awful :(
The server was nice but the food took forever to get to our table The food was nothing to brag about had fish and chips. I probably won't come back.

UPDATE: The Manager from TGI Fridays called me and apologized for the quality of meat on my last visit. She explained, "the meat should always be filet quality". They always try to create the best dining experience possible.  Anytime, customers have a question or concern with a meal they will always try to make it right.  I really appreciated the phone call, and a free meal to compensate for the one I didn't eat. That's good customer service.

This was a horrible experience.  My family and I went out, which we don't do often.  We were seated quickly as it wasn't very busy.  I ordered the steak fajitas and they were terrible.  The steak was not seasoned at all and tasted like it was microwaved.  The plate was so dry that my rice burnt to the plate.  My husbands ribs and shrimp were horrible as well.  He said he would rather eat a McRib than the ribs there.  Even my sons spaghetti was gross. When we got it I had to drain the water from his noodles.  He isn't picky and he wouldn't eat it.  We exchanged it for a grilled chicken breast and he still didn't like it.  The only thing edible was my other sons pizza.  It is hard to mess that up.  We were very disappointed and will not be back.

We were 5 people who ordered hamburgers. This is not rocket science. Only my mother in law had a burger that was done correctly. My son was so hungry he ate his burger although it was well done and charred. He had ordered it medium rare. Then we had to wait over 45 minutes to get the food that was cooked wrong. My husband wanted mushrooms on his burger-it was a little after 6 pm and they were out of mushrooms. It took them another 45 minutes and my burger was well done-I wanted medium rare. I said to take it off the bill. I did not eat it. Then the manager came over - mind you this was the worst experience we ever had, and all she offered were apologies and a 25% discount off the 4 burgers and she said she took off my son's appetizer, but I still had to pay a buck. I really believed that the proper thing to do for us was to charge us 0. People ate in shifts. My mother in law finished her meal before we got a chance to see ours. We were told there was a new chef back there. Sorry, but that is not my problem.

terrible service terrible food. food is over cooked and your waiter or waitress is no where to be found when you need them. oh and don't ask where the bathroom is becuase some rude waitress will look at you like you're stupid. drive 5 more mins to bjs grill and get excellent service and great food.

Starting off with the food, it tasted horrible, we ordered mozzarella sticks that came out relatively cool and tasted like burnt grease. I ordered a steak and it came out rare, when I ordered it medium; my plate was literally filled with blood. Ordered a salad and about 40% of the lettuce had noticeable brown spots on it.  The service was worse than the food. Had to flag down our waitress for everything, drink refills, extra napkins, STRAWS, boxes, the bill, etc. Long story short I will mostly likely never return to this location.

Came here after work on Friday . Staff was very friendly . Got some drinks and food that were good . Had the boneless hot wings ... Way to hot... BBQ chicken flatbread was pretty good and so was the Caesar salad .  The thing that was awesome was the waiter . I think his name was jerod and he helped us pick our food and drinks . Have him the biggest tip I have ever left . People should learn from him
Food is always good at Fridays, but this one in Yorba Linda has really bad service at the bar.  Ignored is the word for today. Not coming back!!

Nothing different about this Friday's location than any other...  Friday's = another boring American chain Waitress was super nice & attentive so that was good. We also got a free appetizer thanks to my YELP check in. I wanted a frozen lemonade & vodka but the bartender couldn't make it. He tried but it just being a slushy class of ice with a shot of alcohol. Ended up sending it back & ordering a Coke. The boneless Buffalo wings were ok but they didn't seem fully cooked to me. I had like 4 of them & was finished.

These guys stay in business because there are not a lot of drink and food options that are open late. The service is terrible. You can wait 15 minutes before anyone shows up. The waitress had 2 tables and disappeared for long periods. We have had this happen several times. The food is mediocre. The worst chicken quesadilla I have ever had was here. It had DICED chicken in it. Del taco's is better. The french dip is good sometimes and fatty other times. I think we kept going back because we thought it had to be beter next time.
Horrible and I mean horrible service this Friday's does not represent the Friday's brand Clean house and start over.........manager read all these reviews

A couple disclaimers about my review: First, this is strictly based on their HAPPY HOUR appetizers and drinks (because that's basically the only time my friends and I come, usually after work). Second, I think the restaurant as a whole is probably closer to a 3-3.5, but you simply can't beat the prices and amount of food you can get from HH. My coworkers and I usually sit in the bar area and the staff are familiar with us and treat us very well.  Jamie and Tim in particular are always extremely friendly, quick, and on point.  I really couldn't ask for more from them.  The appetizers are cheap and decently sized.  We almost always get the nachos, large and taste pretty good for what, $4?  $1.50 for a single slider or fries, $3.50 for a 20 oz beer, $4 well drinks. Overall, a good place to hang out after work with some friends and get cheap food and drinks.  It isn't a Michelin Star restaurant, but it's got a good atmosphere with great staff
The 2 for 20 deals are lame. You get a choice of a boring appetizer and even more boring entree. I chose shrimp which were not fresh. Disappointed.

I've never been a huge Friday's fan, but it's usually alright. We went last night for dinner. The waitress was really nice and we got a free appetizer because we checked in on Yelp. Yay for freebies! So the waitress was really nice, but the service sucked. She kept forgetting things. First of all, we had our 2-year-old with us. My husband and I ordered salads with our meals and she brought them out to us, which was fine, but she didn't bring anything out I had ordered for my daughter. Okay, if you're a parent, and your kid is hungry (and even if they're not hungry), you know to never eat in front of them because they'll flip out. She won't eat salad, so I couldn't share with her. She was going crazy asking where her food was. The waitress walked away and I had to flag her down to ask her to bring something for my very upset kid to eat. She brought crackers. Phew! For our free appetizer, we ordered the hummus. It was good, but I hate it when restaurants don't bring enough chips or bread or whatever you need to eat the dip. We took huge scoops of hummus on our chips, but by the time the small plate of chips was done, the hummus bowl was still half full. There was no offer of more chips. She didn't bring out the drink I ordered until half way through the meal when I reminded her that I had ordered an iced tea. She also didn't bring out the garlic breadsticks that came with my meal until I had finished eating everything and reminded her that I was supposed to have garlic breadsticks. Those were the most half-assed breadsticks I've ever seen and they didn't taste like they had any garlic on them. Yet they were called "garlic breadsticks." Disappointment. Our drinks (water and iced tea) were never refilled. The food was good, but the service was really bad.
They are awesome, this fridays is.friendly and great service! Helpful and are on top of their surveys. Recommended me to do the survey to save.money on an appetizer.

Great service! Our server was friendly and attentive.  We checked-in to receive a free appetizers, little did we know we were there during happy hour which meant most appetizers were half off.  This was not communicated to us. The food was great, a bit expensive since the last time I had been to TGI Friday's but nonetheless great service and friendly employees.
Worst service ever! Wow! Sat at the bar for over 10 minutes without even a hello! Food came out cold. Raising our hands to get service!!! And it was EMPTY

Well I admit that it was a mistake to order steak in a place like this and I don't write reviews in the middle of a meal. The waiter offered good service and I think the main problem with my steak was the quality of the meat and it really put the chef in a difficult spot to cook the meat to the costumers request; my steak was prepared for three times and neither time was satisfactory. My honest advice to this place is that 1.)if TGI wants to continue run business in an area like east Yorba Linda, the food quality really need to go up. Otherwise, with these many negative reviews flooding I think TGI won't be around for long.2.) if you are serious about food and catering, do not come, you will be sorry.
Place was not busy but slow service. Really surprised by the small portions. I spent over $ 60 for two and left not full. Not worth the money

The bar staff is nice, a little bit on the slow side.  Food is typical for Friday's - nothing really stands out.  Would come again as the service, quality, and enviornment is typical for this (type of) chain.
Enjoyed the atmosphere here customer service was good and there 20.00 dollars for 2 was great there dessert was overwhelming.

It was the day before thanksgiving a year ago Friend: Is....isn't that Topanga from "Boy Meets World"? And did her boobs get larger?  Me: Really? Where? Leaving the restaurant and seeing her and her bf walking to their car.  Me: Well what do you know...it is her! And she does have nice boobs!  Hence my first celebrity sighting in OC :) As for the food, blah!
Love the late hours when you get off late most of the week. Yes this is like every other TGIF, but the staff are nice and the beer is always cold, and the drink are always up to par!!

a friend and i decided to grab some food here the other night. It was a very slow Tuesday night as we could see.  we walked in and the host was very nice seated us quickly and said our server would be right with us. We sat... and sat... and waited for someone to walk by our booth yet nothing. we had enough time to memorize what we wanted for our appetizer and dinner as well as dessert. finally we noticed that there was a guy standing in the corner that was gabbing with a lady customer. so we said we would wait another 5 mins and if no one acknowledged that we were alive we would leave. Finally after about 3 minutes of that wait and not even having a glass of water or at least someone asking if we would like something to drink our hunger got the best of us. we ended up walking out with no one even asking if we wanted anything or even acknowledging we walked out. i only give this place 2 stars because the host was very polite. If you want quicker service and similar food.... go to chilies thats what we did!
my bf and I go there every weekend. they have such friendly staff especially at the bar. We have a great time, watch the Angels games and play their trivia games :)

I'm giving this one star because of my "three strikes you're out" rule.  All three recent visits were lunch visits.  All three times were with different staff members.  All three were the same:  filthy dishes and silverware, s l o w  service and lukewarm to cold food.  The employees weren't rude at all, but they couldn't be bothered.  They seriously just didn't give a damn.  Refills?  HA!  Check to see how your food is after someone else dropped it off?  HA!  And be sure to check your bill for accuracy.  Not a problem since you'll have plenty of time to read the bill while you finish your meal.  This really was barely a step-up from fast food.  Okay, it wasn't.  It's all logical now why we always walked right in and sat right away at a nearly empty restaurant.  If you're in the neighborhood, do yourself a favor and find someplace else to eat lunch.  There's a Duke's next door, Chikfila and other places down the street, etc., or maybe scavenge alongside the homeless in the Dumpsters behind the Costco food court.  ANYPLACE is better for lunch than this TGIF's.

I went here for my birthday when I was 13.  Since I was with my family, I don't remember anything fun about the place.  I do remember that they brought out a yucky cream-filled dessert and pushed it in my face and sang Happy Birthday and my mom took pictures to document.  True story.  I was fat at the time so I felt even worse when the whole restaurant turned to look at the hubbub.  I don't remember what I had to eat that meal, and I haven't been back in 10 years.  So I don't think whatever I had was good.  Most likely this is not a place I would recommend.
food sucks. even with a coupon it isnt worth going to eat here. service ALWAYS sucks here. I would not recommend.

went in for my sons 17th birthday terrible experience it took over a hour to get our food and then it came out at 3 different times half the food was wrong and cold , I never saw a manager or a manager never came to the table after I complained to the waitress I spoke with the GM  alan but didn't seem to care they gave me 24 dollars be our guest after we spent over 160 dollars and couldn't eat half of it ,,,, we have had a lot of bad experiences at yorba linda weve given them chance after chance we wont be back we live 5 mins from yorba linda but prefer to go to brea 30 mins away ,,,, if you want a great experience at tgi Fridays go to brea

it's open late.  good for them.  when you live in a town like yorba linda, NOTHING is open late - even starbucks closes JUST when you need that caffeine kick to get you through the night.  so that's good. the service is okay.  the food is very average.  they seem like they're trying to sell on the "we're a cool place to eat at so you should pay more for that," but it doesn't really work.  the desserts look a lot better on the menu than they actually come out. the thing that really tipped me off about tgi friday's was that when i ordered an caesar salad, it came with ICEBERG LETTUCE.  now i'm a fan of lettuce.  but when i order a caesar salad, i expect ROMAINE.  where's my romaine?  what bright mind in the kitchen decided that caesar salad dressing goes with iceberg?!   never again.  i swear to you. anyway, this place should be a last resort.
For a chain food, this place is good.  We got there before the dinner rush, around 5 pm and had two people wait on us.

After having quite a few late night visits after work with some of my co-workers, I've gotten pretty used to this place and the food is pretty good.  They've got a lot of new food to choose from thanks to the Food Network's Guy Fieri. One of my most favorite things there is the Sesame Jack Chicken Strips. Jack Daniel's sauce is absolutely amazing and goes with almost anything. Next on the list is the Tostado Nachos, best nachos ever! And for dessert, The Brownie Obsession -- heart-attack-upset-stomach-all-in-one goodness! Best dessert I've ever had.

I feel like the dissenting voice here, but I love the place for a quick lunch at the bar. Food is good, and they're one of the few places that still have NTN/Buzztime. I personally haven't run into any attitude from the staff.

most of the dishes are fatten.  the ribs came out cold, the salad was old. some of the dishes we order, you can see oil floating . i wonder if they offer liposuction.  we sat at the bar  with 27 customers but only one waitress . at the bar counter, there was 19 customers with 2 bartenders. it was a long,long,long,long wait for our food and drinks. even the customers who came in before us didn't get their food and ask us if we want them. they got up and left. the restroom was  unpleasant.

This restaurant is by far the absolute worst I've ever been to. The staff member (especially the waiter with the stupid star tattoo behind his ear) needs an attitude check as well. There was an empty booth that had yet to be cleaned and I asked the snooty staff member if it's ok to wait by the booth or in it.  As he's walking by us, he said "They're still cleaning it" without even looking at me or the party I was with. He just kept on walking. No apology. Not even a smile on his face. So we all sat down and waited about 10 minutes just to get the menus. The table still wasn't cleaned at all. Another 20 minutes goes by and nothing...we don't see anyone come by to see if we needed anything at all. I like TGI Fridays and their food, but this particular restaurant needs a complete overhaul on its staff. That being said, I'll NEVER come back. I'll also tell anyone and everyone never to go there.
Went in for an early dinner and the service was ok. The food was ok. nothing bad. The place is clean and the service was ok.

Unfortunately the years have not changed what this place offers. As before, college kids tending at the bar not so great. Little eye contact unless you make an advance. The girl making my martini misunderstood my request for a really dry martini to mean extra Dry Vermouth, bluck.  The sizzling chicken and spinach for $14.99 gave us one small thin slice or half of a dry chicken breast with some spinach, a few pieces of squash and we counted five small caramelized onion rings. We each had three bites of chicken. Two globs of salty mashed potatoes had the 1/3 of the plate. We usually split a meal just about everywhere we go--not here! How sad when there are only a handful of places to eat in this area. I guess another try in a couple more years would be a mistake. Again. Management? No bar back. No support.

Terrible. Just believe the posts. There was only one girl working here. The girl did awesome! I say she did awesome because she handled 10+ tables on her own. But I felt bad having to bug her because she was running the bar, and the tables all by herself. The food quality was great and so were the appetizers. I just don't like going into a restaurant where you feel bad having to ask for re-fills, sauce, etc. I just ate what I had, and I didn't bother asking her for additional stuff.
Very consistent with major corporate restaurants. Very pleased with food and waitress. She was on top of our table. Very quiet night.

This place sucks first of all its 2/17/16  about 8:00pm and this place sucked little short white kid who was the hostess at the front didn't even greet me had to ask him if I had  to sit ourself or what was going on... its like a old fashion wood bar witch was way out of date I just left !

Came to this location tonight with my family for dinner. We usually go to the location in Orange, but we were in the area.  The food here was great. Same good quality you get at most Fridays. Jack Daniels ribs are some of the best ribs you'll get at ANY restaurant, and the flat iron steak my wife got was fantastic. I Tried one of the seasonal drinks and it was delicious.  Unfortunately, the service and atmosphere are lacking at this location, or at least tonight. Our waiter was very nice and friendly but he seemed to be overwhelmed. He was rushing us every time we needed something and my drink along with my sons chocolate milk took over 10 minutes to get a refill.  The dining room at this location is a little crowded. Bathroom could've been cleaner, but that is always an issue at Friday's. If your in the area and looking for good drinks or a good meal, check it out.

Went to Fridays for lunch. When we arrived and ordered a burger we were told they were out of burgers. When we changed our order to turkey burgers day and formed us they were out of turkey burgers. They told us we could have a substitute the double burger patties for the regular burgers but wanted to charge us the double burger price for the single burger. I ordered the bruschetta pasta and it was cold. The only reason I'm giving them two stars is because the waitress was accommodating

Bad service!! Our waiter was slow, he didn't check on the table, he didn't ask if we would like the option of dessert before just simply bringing out our check. However, of course was quick to get it once we paid!

This place has gone downhill.  I was once again dragged here by my family and once again we received horrible service. It took over 20 minutes to get our drinks.  Finally got a refill after asking 3 times.  I don't blame the waitress for getting snippy with my dad since he was kind of irritated about not getting his drink refilled for another 15 minutes. But then again she is a waitress and should have focused on customer service rather than her own feelings.  The only reason I gave this place 2 stars was because after we finally got our food it was not bad. I won't be coming back until I start seeing an overwhelming positive response on their reviews.
My fav place yum the Dragon-fire salmon crab cakes are sooo good! Service  is great; bar is wonderful who new brunch !! Jajaja! Everyone, silly- rainy-day!

This was the worst meal I've had in a long time. I ordered a Cheeseburger but instead they served the All American Burger. The two patties were cooked so well done that they tasted like charcoal briquets. It was supposed to have thousand island dressing but I couldn't taste any. The bun was also stale. Really disappointing and horrible. If I could give them zero stars I would.

The food itself was decent. But, the beer menu isn't that great. All proprietary beers. We live in an area of great microbreweries, they should be on the menu also. Even places like Red Robin carry craft beers!  The service was so poor I didn't leave a tip. Took 10min for a drink order, every time the waitress asked us if we wanted a ..... She would forget and ask a second time after we had already been waiting. For example, she brought me a bottled beer with the bottle only. Asked if I wanted a glass, I said yes but never brought it. Asked again, and still never brought it. Probably will never eat here again.

Two of my coworkers and I came in for lunch and had a VERY poor experience.  Slow service. Had to get our own silverware. We got the BLT + A and there was literally 1 piece of bacon and 1 slice of avocado and I also found a hair in my food. The manager brought me new food,  but not before commenting that two of his cooks were bald. I have been to this location many times and never had a problem, but this time was bad enough to keep me from going back. I love TGIF, but do NOT recommend this location.

Walked in at 12 pm and was told by the bartender she already made last call for food orders when they close at 1am. What's up with that? Then at 12:45 the bartender brings her dog into the restaurant and has it behind the bar.  Are you kidding me? What kind of restaurant allows their employees to do this.  Every single time I have come here I have had terrible service and have has to ask for a manager to complain. Honestly, I do not recommend this location.

Horrible. I mean how does a bartender not know how to make a Tom Collins?! One of the drinks every bartender should know. Plus they took awhile to greet and help us. We were at the bar late night. Plus the manager or whoever she is is just sitting at a table talking to other employees. Unprofessional and not once has she gone up to talk to other customers to see if they are doing ok.
Service is good. Food is nothing special. Chicken sucked. Fries didn't look like picture. Food not worth the price.
Sloooow service. Food came out cold. Pot stickers are good! I probably won't be back here.

Worst service ever. Did not get a greeting or a smile from the receptionist and the server was the worst. She just passed by without asking how we are doing it update with the food. I asked about if I got the right drink and she's like well that's what input in the computer. She came to our table 2x to get the order and give us our check.

The food is always good here, but this place has slowly been going down hill and needs some help! It has been FILTHY the past two times we have gone there. We were sat at a table with food all over the floor and seats. The high chair for our baby was gross and broken and the host gave us MAJOR attitude when we asked for a new one. He insisted that it wasn't broken...well it didn't have half of the strap so, yes, broken! Also, the bathrooms need some upgrades. They are just as run down and smell just as terrible as most gas station bathrooms, if not worse!
Hey what can I say it's Fridays and u can't beat nachos and a beer for less than bucks

Worst TGIF EVER The beer is gross... the lines are dirty and the bottle beer is WAY OLD.  To make things worse the bartenders got mad at me when I asked for a new beer ... not because I asked.. but because I interrupted the 2 of them gossiping about other employees. Stay away from this shit hole.  I have been in there a few times and tried the beer.. they never fix it. I have talked to the GM and I always get the same " im sorry it will be fixed" bull crap.  Fix your beers and fix your employees.

I wish I could put 0 stars but I'm gonna put 1 cause the food was worth it. Unfortunately for me, it's more important the customer service than the food. I ordered a Mojito cause in general Fridays has really good drinks. Well, the Mojito was a disaster!! It taste horrible, so I politely asked the server if she could change the drink for me and which one would she recommend that tasted sweet and sour as a mojito and that the bar tender did well. So she recommended some raspberry drink and she told me that was very good. Well, when I got the drink it was undrinkable! It was so so strong but I thought that maybe it was just me... So I told my husband to try it out and he thought the same thing his face just got disfigured when he had the first taste! So the server asked me if it was ok and I said No, but didn't want to be a bitch and changed it all over again. Well, 5 minutes later she brought the check and she actually charged us the drink that I never drunk!  So I left very disappointed and of course left the drink intact over the table. I'm definitely not coming back to this Fridays again! No wonder why every time I've been here it's empty!

This TGI Fridays is for some reason a place of frustration. We have been here several times, sometimes the food is cold and the drinks not cold enough. Once we came in around 9:30pm and sat in the bar area, after 15 minutes we actually called on the phone to ask for a server, 5 minutes later one arrived and we placed our drink order, 10 minutes later we left with out having a drink or food. On Thursday we went and had a great experience, very cold beer, nice hot food and a full rack of ribs for $10.99. We were happy... Today 7/30/16 we went there for dinner the $10.99 ribs and bourbon chicken were sounding good, much to our surprise, we were told that the ribs were only at the corporate stores, after speaking to the manager she also told us they wouldn't do the ribs for that price. We couldn't get a cold beer on tap because of a refrigeration problem, so once again we left frustrated and disappointed. TGI Fridays - this store is problematic, franchised or not, we won't be back.

This TGI Friday's gives all other TGI Friday's a bad name. Unfortunately this is the closest one to my home. The service is typically slow and not very friendly. They are a franchise and do NOT honor the prices advertised on TGI Friday's television commercials. Went the other night and had a decent experience so we decided to give it another try again tonight, big mistake! Never again, we've learned our lesson. Sad when a manager would rather watch 4 people walk out of her restaurant than try to accommodate them.
it was very cold in here tonight. Shad to leave bc we were freezing. the drinks were good and all day happy hour. Long Island Iced Tea are the best here.

What do you think of when you think of TGIF?   Potato skins and Jack Daniels, right?   We'll cross off the potato skins at this failing chain.   My wife ordered the skins and after one bite said something had changed.  We began looking and the cheese was crumbly and the bacon limp.  She said these are frozen.   She was right.  She asked the waitress who told us yes they are just like the ones in the freezer section.  The waitress told us they get complaints all of the time but their corporate office won't listen.  Well listen to this.  We aren't coming back and time for TGIF to fade away like so many others who think they can cut quality and still charge more.

I love most Fridays but not this one. The service was terrible and very slow. They were not accommodating at all with our 2 little children and we're more worried about a fire hazard with the car seat in the aisle then finding something comfortable for us. Then we saw a sign for build your own Cadillac margaritas for $8 and we thought wow that's fun we will try that. The waitress took our order to then come back 10 minutes later to say oh that's not available anymore even though the sign was still hanging up right above our table. Them when the food came our soft breadsticks with cheese sauce were hard and the spinach dip was room temperature. Needless to say we will not be back to this Fridays. The host and waitress both looked liked they didn't want to be there and never even saw a smile in their face.

My wife and i where EXTREMELY  DISAPPOINTED! Everything we ordered was very poorly cooked and the food itself seem bad or old. TGIF- what happened to the love for the food.?  DONT EAT HERE.WASTE OF A MEAL!!

Went here a week ago with my girlfriend after work to grab something small eat and drink. Took a little while to get seated even though there were open tables, so we opted to sit at the bar to speed things up. Once seated, we ordered a few appetizers and drinks. For appetizers, it sure did take a while, we finished our drinks and ordered another round before they brought out our food. The one thing that stood out was the mozzarella sticks we ordered, which came out last after our sesame jack chicken strips.  Sesame jack chicken strips were tasty but the mozzarella sticks came out warm and were not cheesy/gooey in any way.
