And the marinara sauce that came out with it was all watery and wouldn't even hold onto the mozzarella sticks if its life depended on it. I've had enough frozen food in my times to cautiously say those excuses for moz sticks  came straight from the freezer. I just hope they weren't serving food that I could've bought straight from the frozen section of my local grocery store and prepared better at home. Overall, drinks were great, sesame jack chicken strips was good, but STAY AWAY from the mozzarella sticks. That was a waste of money

I came here with my mom for dinner and we ended get several appetizers. It was pretty cool because not only was it happy hr (1/2 off appetizers and some drinks) but the check in offer that they had for this location was pretty much a free appetizer thats valued at 8bucks!! We def got more food for our buck and its  been a while since i have come to a tgif. Overall the food was great and the service was good comsidering how busy the bar area was. I would def go back for the secret deals :)
Ribs were overdone, burger was too well done, good baked potato. Strawberry shortcake has 1 strawberry - one. Waitress in wrong job. Way too indifferent and surly
If there was a no star rating I would give it.. this place was awful  overpriced and the food was not good. The service was mediocre  and the place didn't have that feel good vibe.

I called in an order for pick up. I ordered two burgers and an appetizer. Wanted to use my Yelp check in and they wouldn't let me. On top of that when I came in they told me the burger I ordered wasn't on the menu any more. So they offered to take the burger off the bill, however, when they brought me the bill to pay nothing was compensated.  Pretty poor customer service and training by the management staff. No wonder more than half the restaurant was empty.

Nothing is as pictured on the menu! The mouthwatering double burger with grilled sausage, arrived with no sausage and when we pointed it out, or server apologized and whisked it back to the kitchen! Then the manager came by to apologize and say the sausage wasn't thawed or prepped, so what would we like?! We asked for our burger and fries back! A big mistake! Everything ordered by our table way over salted and lukewarm! Save your $12.99 and go to In n Out or Red Robin! our server was great, but we felt bad for him that he had to serve overpriced slop! No wonder there was no wait on a Saturday night at dinner time! Never again!
Just Bad food and service .... Shrimp cocktail unbelievably poor .... Server / bartender was very odd .... Rear of restaurant had a very bad smell.

By far one of the worst TGIF restaurants I have been to. Terrible service. Took our waiter about 15 minutes to get us drinks on a slow night. Food took another 15-20 and we didnt have silverware. A food runner dropped off our food and then left. I didn't expect much of him because he wasn't our server but he left so quickly we couldn't even ask for a fork. The manager was no where in sight. Later tgif in Yorba Linda. Not coming back
Best service!! Our waiter was very attentive and even though my kids were acting up he kept his cool, did not have to ask for a single thing he was always one step ahead of us!

I ended up here after we had absolutely no clue where to eat. I believe it may have been Easter so most of our top choices were closed. We had terrible service even though the place was not all that busy. Our server seemed to give exceptional service to another table who sat down after us. All we wanted was a hot meal that tasted good and refills on our sodas. We didn't even get that.

my review is solely based on happy hour buffalo wings. GET THEM inferno. it's their spiciest wings and they are so goood. For some reason I find the wings more spicy when they're traditional and less spicy when they're boneless. hmm.. fried green beans, basket of fries, and shrimp cocktail are pretty good too.. good selection of beers, wines, and alcoholic drinks. They have daily specials on their drinks which are $5. Their margaritas are pretty big and they don't skimp on the alcohol. This place has my favorite wings. I love wings and come here to get them. their fries are seasoned really well too. mmm salt..
Im gonna have to give this Fridays 5 stars because its a mellow Fridays. If you want a chill night with some drinks and not a huge crowd...come here. Service is good, nothing extraordinary.

I have to say, even I'm surprised. But, in all honesty Fridays is pretty good. The beer is ice cold, the food is decent, and the price is fair. We eat in the bar, and the service is friendly.  Combine all this with the fact that they are open late, and I'm one happy girl :-)

Background info: I used to work for Friday's and bartended for about a year and a half.  I headed over to this place after a basketball game from work and had the worst service ever - and this is coming from a server. It was a group of 14 or so and we sat ourselves in the bar. The bartop had at least maximum six or so people. Took the bartender at least ten minutes to greet us and almost forgot to get the order off of one of the people in our group. Drinks took well over fifteen minutes ( most of them were on the rocks and basic rum/coke) and the food lagged hardcore ( all appetizers) The bartender also forgot to put in my salad and never got me a water. I mean I am all about forgetting things here and there but to absolutely forget? Pssh.  All of us were peeved when we left knowing we were going to still leave her at least 18% tip since we all work in the service industry. I prefer to go to a Friday's that actually cares about the people at the bar. Which is why the Friday's at the Block is where I go to.

after a long day of snowboarding; it was either Carls or TGIF.. i voted for TGIF thinkin it was better than fast food.. while it wasnt that bad, it wasnt that good either.. Whether mac n cheese, steak or jackd ribs its no YardHouse.  Service was disappointing but i cant blame them its gotta be hard.  I dont look at the SaviRanch center as a poppin place to be.  Its got such real estate potential.  Or maybe being the only real restaurant there they should do better? idk you be the judge.

Came here on a Friday night for Happy Hour.  Arrived at like 4pm it was empty.  The bar was pretty empty till about 5:00 maybe then a few more people walked in.  I didnt see mojitos on the menu but I asked for a pom mojito and she made it for me!  It was delicious!  My friend ordered two beers and the total for all three drinks was about $14.  So not too bad!  Overall service was good, drinks were good.  Not much a fun environment but not too bad for a quick drink.

Sevice seems to always suck.  Not sure why I bother to come back.  Nothing worse than placing an order that included a dinner salad.  After nearly 15 min and no salad I ask  the server is the salad coming out before my burger?  Yes of course she says.  Another 5 min she brings the salad, 1 of the 2 ordered at the table.  She had to be reminded there was another ordered.  And on que As I'm eating my salad the main course arrives.  No there very little room on the table for all the food.  What to do, ditch the over priced salad  and eat my burger and fries or watch them get cold while finishing my salad.  Then once we're done the waitress comes by to ask if we want the endless fries refilled.  sure we do, does she bother to clear the dirty plates we're done with.  Nope, she just bails.  I can see why the service consistently suck at this location.  Never have seen a manager or supervisor walking the floor and talking with customers for feed back.  I guess they don't want to know how  their staff  serves their customers.

Really didnt llike the service here, but its fridays, and it was friday.  So lots of people out after working thier jobs, enjoying the nigh with a beer and watching a game on the television.  Blah, me and the wifey are food critics at shabby but upscale places like this.  The two for 20 buck deal is a rip off, so its imperative to stay away from it.  Or else you will fimilarize yourself on three visits with the iited menu options.

The food is as good as any TGIF chain is. BUT the service was absolutely HORRENDOUS! Steer clear of the server Spencer H. Redneck low life who couldn't add or tally up the amount of items that were ordered. Mumbled his way through taking orders, tallied up the bill wrong -TWICE (possibly because he didn't know how to use a register) and failed to apologize. He was stupid enough to think that he had the last laugh on us (hamming it up in the back w/other servers on our account-which we overheard). Will never step foot in that TGIF location again and will make certain that others are aware! Glad to have left 0 tip! Worst service by far. He definitely blew it for all the other servers there who do work their tails off to provide good service.

Well I admit that I normally only come here to eat with family and sometimes a few friends.  The food "selection" is just fine. It's nice that they have a bigger menu selection than most other places I go to, but well...it's a chain restaurant.  And I do appreciate they're late hours. However, it's something about the over-sized booths that make you have to lift your arms high elbowing your neighbor just to cut the steak since the seats are so low (or table is too high).  And please TGIF if you're going to have a big display of alcohol up on display shelves above the bar (ie they're going to be there for a while since you probably need a high stool or short ladder to get them down), have them all faced forward...especially when they're square bottles. The dining experience here is never really that great.  However, I admit that the servers have been very accommodating to my family's whims and needs.  Not to say that we're "those" people.  But with my brother having a broken jaw wired shut, we asked to get his soups blended so he could drink it through a straw and they did their best.  Relatively at least lol...they were able to puree a broccoli cheese soup, but apparently not a creamy tomato soup...who knew?  And maybe I'm just lucky, but despite the fact that the actual steak cuts themselves (and quality) could be better...whenever I've ordered a medium-rare, it has actually come out...medium-rare.  Not medium-well like most places.  In the end though, the food is "Meh.  I've experienced better." Anyway, I'm sure my family will come here to eat still every once in a while.  But does that mean it's great?...no not really.

Where else to go around the Yorba Linda-Anaheim Hills area for your alcohol fix than TGIFridays? They've got great Happy Hour deals on both drink and food at night. I feel like my friends and I buy so much stuff and the check is still cheap. I grew up in Anaheim Hills so this is a great place to meet up with high school buddies.

So this is one of the only places near my house that has good food, not AMAZING, but its good, they have good drinks and he prices are also really affordable. I always come here with my friends when we dont know where else to go because they have something that all of us will like and we will be satisfied.

Horrible experience. Had 7 people and came specifically because we had 3 birthdays in the family. Spent over 200$ Didn't sing or anything even after we specifically asked. Yet everyone around us was getting b-day desserts and singing. Salads dressing was non existent on all of our salads, mozzarella sticks came with sour cream...?? Overall rude and could care less about our requests. Will not be returning even though we live up the street.

good stuff.  This place is your standard TGIF, it happens to have a great wait staff that put up with all sorts of crap from well-meaning patrons. hah. The food was up to snuff and the drinks were loaded. I had the jack daniels burger the last time I was here and the cooked it *perfectly*. god i love that burger. we were also drinking gin n tonics like all night and the bartender was not being skimpy on the tanqueray.  I'd definitely come back again.  happy hour 10 pm - close

The only gripe I have is the sound system for the Jukebox, One Word... Weak, They need to upgrade the sound system, then customers would put more money and stay longer. Fridays needs to take notes from 50/50's jukebox down the street

You know your part of town sucks when TGI Friday's is the local watering hole and one of the only things open past 11 o'clock. Anaheim hills/Yorba Linda is the perfect place for a fern bar, this place fills up. The food here sucks. On the bright side happy hour makes the beer cheap and makes the crappy food taste better.

Don't get take out from here!!!! first off like every Fridays terrible (that's being nice) service I waited a very long time to even get service to get my food and when I got back to work and opened the bags no forks, no balsamic salad dressing (I got a balsamic Caesar salad!!! disappointed it sounded good too bad!!), I think it's unfair that I should have to drive back on a limited lunch break and ask for these things... this is not the 1st time I have had terrible take out service from this restaurant I just felt I should give it another chance it had been a couple years... not sure why I tell people to go to this restaurant in the 1st place......soooo disappointed!!!! seems that my co-workers order seemed right!! but she even said hers was gross!! sweet potato fries were cold.....We paid a lot of money to throw a lot of it away!! soy sauce is not a good salad dressing especially when the chicken seemed like it was pulled out of the refrigerator and cooked earlier (old not appealing or appetizing) in the day dry and again gross!!!!! no just no I will not do this to myself and my co-workers again!!! and the only reason this restaurant is recommendable is sports are on in the bar and it's opened late!!......We wanted to treat ourselves and I feel we got a bad deal not coming back and I'm really not interested in sending people to this restaurant :(
Good food and with happy hour on Sundays all day makes for an inexpensive sit down for a meal the Few times I've been there good service as well

Love this location! We have been going here for years and are never disappointed. The staff is always friendly and helpful. They have lots of variety on the menu and the food is very good for reasonable price. Thanks!
They lost my credit card!!!! They gave it to another customer!! They were not even apologetic about it. Horrible service, tiny portions, and they were out of fries!

This place was a total let down. Stopped in on a Monday afternoon had an attentive, knowledgeable bartender. Insert shift change, our new bartender, Ellina, was possible the worst bartender I have EVER had.. We ordered 2 drinks and 1 appetizer.. She never even put in the appetizer!! We had to get it from the bartender that was already off of his shift! No joke or exaggeration, our non-alcoholic drinks say empty for more than 30 minutes, while we were swimming in empty plates and glasses. We were sitting at the bar.. It's not like she didn't walk past us AT LEAST 20 times.. We expected chain restaurant food not piss poor service. Never going back!

It was my 1st time in the area &their service here is great!! My waitress Kaylee did beyond an awesome job! The food was on time &she made sure we were very comfortable. &she didnt nag or forget about us like most waiters/ waitresses do. (I hate tht) anyways,  I enjoyed myself &will definitely come back :-) 5 stars!

I have been here several times over the last year. It is a nice local place to grab some lunch or dinner. Conveniently located in Savi Ranch near the freeway (might not want to risk trying to navigate around Savi Ranch during rush hour). There is plenty of parking.  The host/hostess are ALWAYS very friendly and enthusiastic. Upon being seated, the guest is told the name of their server and wished an enjoyable meal (every time in my experience). I have not yet had a bad server/service there. Last night it was Joseph (Joe) and he was GREAT! He was friendly, attentive, accurate and very genuine & personable. Food came out in a reasonable amount of time, drinks were refilled in a timely manner as well. The resturant is clean and there is a patio which is nice, but it is somewhat bland and boring out there.  I won't comment on the taste of the food (since that is subjective and everyone's taste is different) but the quality of the ingredients is good and the food is appropriately hot or cold when it comes to the table.  I have eaten in the bar area one time and felt that the service was equally as good as in the dining room and the patio. I expect to return here regularly.
Came on a Sunday got seated quickly. Food came out hot! Awesome service. We order wings and potato skins. Came out hot!!! Yum!!!!!

My wife and I were undecided on what to grab on a Wednesday evening so we decided to hang out at Friday's.  We didn't have high expectations so we weren't disappointed. My wife had baby back ribs and they were ok.  Not a lot of meat and they weren't the type to "fall off the bone". I had the Jack Daniel's premium steak & shrimp.  The steak was medium (instead of medium rare as I ordered), and I had to literally scrape the shrimp from their shells. The service was good, but the restroom wasn't clean and that was a turn off. 3-Stars for a typical TGI Friday experience.

This used to be my fiancé and I's favorite place to go to get a good dinner and some appetizers when they were having their 1/2 priced deal at 10pm . It had recently been closed for a kitchen fire and one night we wondered if they were open again and they were and we decided to eat there like old times . It was one of the worst experiences ever . They weren't busy at all and sat us right away but after that it all went down hill . The food was awful tasting and the service was awful . Our waitress was nice but we would ask for things and she would go missing for what felt like 30 mins . I knew it wasn't just me who was unhappy with our meal when I looked over and saw another couple sending their food back and I could hear the manager apologizing . I was so mad that I had wasted the money on such a horrible meal and we won't be going back ! I hope people that do go there have much better luck than we did but I would not recommend it to anyone .

Maybe I'm being harsh but 3 stars is about what I would expect. The food was good and delivered in a reasonable time. The strangeness came when it was time to redeem a coupon. They actually had to get a manager to come verify the coupon. It's an electronic coupon with a code. You would think that we have come far enough that the code would be unique and the server could use it. Something is broken if this isn't working.  The food, well, for the price it was just a 3 stars. It was cooked right and taste was what was expected.  Typical for a Fridays the place was noisy and when a large group left the clatter from the bus boys re-arranging the tables was a bit loud and annoying. I understand they have to reset, but this was near closing and there were no people waiting to be seated. The shuffle could have waited 10 minutes for us to be done and leave. This was a good place 12 years ago when I was in college. Not so any more. On my recent and last trip the booth had an unpleasant smell. While the waitress was nice service was lacking our drinks were only refilled once and we revived the wrong food. When we pointed this out we were given attitude my the manager. The quality and taste of the burger I  had was similar to that if McDonalds. Now 4 hours after our meal My wife and I are dealing with the after effects. In summary if you want consistently crappy food and service eat here. In talking to my

Horrible service. I was at the bar with my friend and there were seven people or less at the bar at any time. The TWO bartenders just walked by us as we sat with empty drinks at an empty bar. They would leave to talk to their friends outside of the bar and instead of asking us for another drink, they would ask if we were ready to close out. One bartender just pouted around all night while the other would look past me and my friend with empty drinks

First time at this particular TGIF. Make a long story short we are never coming back. We got seated right away, which wasn't bad. We did wait a good 15-20 min before the waitress took our drinks/order. We asked for water and lemon, only got water. When our food got to our table, the appetizer cheese sticks had hair on the plate (we were nice and didn't complain about that since the hair wasn't on any of the cheese sticks). The burger we ordered was over cooked and charred black, they brought us what looked like fries that somebody had been picking off the plate. To add onto the fries issue, the waitress did tell us that the fries were the last of the previous batch and that they would bring more on a separate plate. It was a joke. The pasta we ordered was horrible. The plate was hot but the pasta was cold, and the chicken in the bruschetta pasta felt like it came straight out microwave and it was very dry. The waitress was nice, we wouldn't blame her for the crappy food, but service was horrible in general; very slow. The waitress had the manager comp our dinner and only charged us for the appetizer, gave us some coupons for a free appetizer and dessert for our next visit, but I doubt we're ever coming back to use them. Lesson learned I should've read the yelp reviews beforehand.

TGI Fridays seems to have an ever changing menu and I really like that. I loooove that all day on Sunday's it's Happy Hour!! Woohoo!! I mainly go here to sit at the bar, watch whatever game happens to be on the telly, order a bunch of appetizers and drink a few beers. Never sit among the masses at the regular tables-BORING! Service is always good and food comes out hot. Beer is always ice cold and my glass/bottle never really gets a chance to get empty before I am asked if I want another.  This place makes me happy :-)

They have endless appetizer promotion now.. $10 per appetizer and u can eat unlimited.. We order cheese stick, boneless wings & Spanish dip.. These three dishes are all good and the staffs are pretty nice.. H can sit there and chat with ur friends on Friday night.. It's a such good experience!! The all u can eat appetizer won't exist forever so go try it!!!

Not a big fan of TGIF anyways and after last weeks visit there, it will be my last !!! Corp office - you better clean house with all the servers, including the bar tender and starting with the manager. Terrible service, less then stellar food and big time attitudes. Shame on the corp office for taking so long to even recognize it !!!!

The Men's Restroom was disgusting. Looks like cheap bar. Piss every where u stand. It was horrible. We were very hungry , ordered couple appetizers,  steak n lobster, few drinks. Food came in right on time, taste was awesome..!! The waitress was nice. Even charged my phone. No complain. Honored the check in coupon.

The food was fine, price was good, but it reminds me of when you go to an old persons house and you ask yourself "When was the last time they cleaned it?" Tables , floor, and bathrooms were dirty. The whole place just needs a deep clean and it could be ok. When places are that dirty it makes you wonder about the kitchen.
The food was not good, took forever to get our drinks, I would not go back.The shrimp was obviously frozen shrimp dumped onto a fryer.

I've been here twice recently.  This past Sunday we went after a baptism.  We ordered a lot of different things. For appetizers the dragon fire shrimp (or something of the sort) was pretty delicious. We ordered the triple dipper appetizer. The cheese dip was nothing to write home about, the hummus was good, I didn't even try the salsa, didn't look appetizing.  I ordered the salad with strawberries, goat cheese, balsamic and walnuts. It was yummy. I also ordered the pasta with shrimp instead of chicken, tomatoes garlic sauce and capers. The pasta was delicious but they went overboard on the capers IMO.  The service was decent, not bad, but nothing to write home about either. We had one billing issue, but it was resolved pretty quickly.

I have to admit I wasn't impressed the last time, but today I was pleased to find the menu has changed. They still have the old delicious standbys (yay!) but there are a few more offerings that sounded pretty good. I didn't choose any of those though. I had the Jack Daniels rib-eye steak. It was cooked perfectly and had a nice char on the outside. You can't go wrong with anything that has the Jack Daniels sauce. I love it!  They added spinach as a side dish. It is lightly sautéed with mushrooms and onions. Try it, you'll like it. If you haven't been to TGIFridays in a while (like me), you should give them another try. The servers, by the way, are always nice and seem genuinely appreciative to have you visit.
Love the bartenders at this location! Can't beat the happy hour specials. Good variety in draft beers. Love the pretzel appetizer.

The food here is incredibly decent. The only problem is that this specific location is never up-to-date on their items. Otherwise, I've never had a bad meal there. The drinks there were always weak. Also, they cut you off after 5 drinks, which to most people sounds like a lot, but when you're with a bunch of your friends, sitting outside and smoking and talking for like 65 hours straight, 5 drinks is nothing.  When I used to go here, I would sit either at the bar or outside. The inside table seating is awkward and weird, and definitely not well thought out. Otherwise, if you are going here for the food, a lot of their lunch specials are a steal!  Eh. If you haven't been to TGI Friday's, I suppose you should go just so you can write a review too. :P

Ah, TGI Friday's. I remember you from my college years, when I was a wide-eyed gal from a small town on a trip into San Francisco. There was a really cool TGI Friday's nestled in an old building. The place was packed. It seemed so cool. Where have the good days gone? We have stopped at this TGI Friday's a few times for a drink and a snack. After a day of running errands, it seemed like a good place for some respite. After all, we were just in the area.  This time, we walked in. The staff is always reasonably friendly. There is always room for one more at the bar. I still enjoy the atmosphere. Then I reviewed the menu and remembered that this just isn't a place that I enjoy.  I have tried most of the items on the appetizer menu and they were just ok. There are other sports bars with better wings. There are other sports bars with better potato skins. This time we turned around and found solace elsewhere.  Perhaps it's this Friday's. Perhaps it's me. Either way, these aren't the good ole days.
Garbage place. My wife's wallet was stollen last night. Nothin but little kids running the place. Btw the place has no security system so have at it!
At the restaurant service is so slow been here for 30 min got the drink order wrong waiting for appetizers for 20 min why do o keep coming back
Typical chain restaurant, the food is never healthy, more like bar food, even though they claim that they have lighter items on the menu. Not worth going to this place.

Gave 1 star only because they have a bar. Worst service I have ever had from a TGI Fridays. Been here twice and both times we were treated like we weren't there. Waited 30 minutes for drinks and never got asked if we wanted refills. Over an hour later appetizers were finally coming out which would be ok if the place was beyond full. This place was pretty epmty maybe 20% full. Also how do you place 1 waiter for a group of 15?! TAKE A LONGER DRIVE AND DRIVE TO THE BLOCK...you'll regret coming here if you have a group larger than 4 ppl.

I can count with my one hand, that's how many times I've been to TGIF.  While I didn't find the food horrible, I didn't find it appealing, either.  Their famous Jack Daniel's entrees tasted all too sweet for my liking.  I get coupon flyers all the time in the mail but they often ended up in the trash.  Now I love a good bargain but it still has to taste semi-descent for me to spend the money to buy one entree to get the second one free.   I had a light salad for lunch.  I was barely full but resisted the urge to get more food because I have been eating a lot of good food all weekend because of the Costa Mesa Restaurant Week.  When I got home, I was too hungry to cook.  Looking through the mail, I saw TGIF coupon flyer.  "Want to give it a try?" my fiance asked.  We haven't been there in like 10 years.  "Sure, why not?"  I replied.  I was too lazy and too hungry to think or drive anywhere further for dinner.  Besides, it's buy one entree get a second one free.    On a Tuesday night, the restaurant had a good crowd but still plenty of seats available.  We were seated right away and our server came within minutes.  She handed us the menu and we ordered our usual iced tea.     After glancing the menu for a few minutes, I decided on Bruschetta Chicken Pasta - Multi-grain angel hair pasta tossed in Bruschetta marinara - made with sliced garlic, basil and Roma tomatoes - topped with fire-grilled chicken breast. Drizzled with balsamic glaze and sprinkled with Parmesan shavings.   Surprisingly, the chicken was not dry at all.  The pasta actually tasted pretty good.  I thought it could use a little more sauce but it had enough garlic and hit of balsamic to give it the flavor.   My fiance got the Sizzling Chicken & Shrimp - Sauteed garlic-marinated chicken breast and delicious shrimp tossed in a Bruschetta marinara.  Served with onions, peppers, and creamy mash potatoes on a sizzling platter of melted American and Mexican cheeses.    This had pretty bold flavor but was a bit greasy and salty.   Our bill with 2 entrees and 2 drinks only came to around $23 before tips.  Really not bad.  For casual dinning, I think TGIF will suffice.  I think I will keep the coupon flyer instead of tossing it in the trash next time.
Happy hour is from 3 to 7pm The Pot Stickers on the appetizer menu are pretty good.

Terrible service, our waitress sucked. After she dropped our food off she never came back to check on how our food was or ask if we needed anything. I ordered the rack of ribs which was the only good thing about my visit.
Great happy hour in the early evening and late night. Service sometimes is pretty slow.

This place is fantastic especially during hour. Get your rewards card because the prices are awesome! Staff is super friendly and helpful. You get your food and drinks quickly. The cheese sticks are amazing! The happy hour specials are hard to beat. I love this place I don't understand how people dislike this place. It was a little slow in the bar, but that's fine by me since i was there to watch football.   Our server was great, very friendly and quick on refills.  Our food came out Hot and sizzling even though the dining side of the restaurant was busy. They also have $6 drink deals right now for the month of October.  Halloween theme drinks that are different (in a good way) from your regular cocktails.  This location is better than the Orange location, (you know, "the block" or whatever it's called now.)

Very bery bad service and food , took us 15 mins to get someone's attention to get us seated on a Thursday at 3:00, waiters and waitresses were non friendly, by the time we get our food it was cold and hard. I would defiantly not come here again

The waiters took longer and longer to come to the table and take an order, let alone bring our drinks, meal, or even a refill of soda. Again, it wasn't a matter of the place being too busy or understaffed, we had several servers walking past our table, not acknowledging our presence. Perhaps because I have experienced better places, or maybe it is just this location, but this place didn't impress me like other TGIF's have before. 0.5 - Food Quality & 5.0 - Service = 2 STARS!  Only two reasons to come to this location, the Katy Perry looking server & the Middle Eastern / Indian looking girl, both excellent servers and good with kids.  Other than that something is seriously wrong with this location, especially the kitchen!! When you order French Onion Soup on 5 consecutive visits and it comes out different everytime!  Servers are attentive and friendly, managers are lazy and unattentive (I have owned restaurants, so I can spot the issues immediately). LOVE the FOLKS that WORK there but the food is just what you expect from a TGIF!  Friendly atmosphere and exactly what you want if you want a TGIF experience but maybe better because the people who work there are XOXO
good place to go for a week night dinner w/ a nice cold beer.

Why all the really low ratings? I've eaten here many times, I get what I expect and never had any difficulties. Many times the party I was with was probably more of a nuisance than other patrons and still there never was a problem. Like today. I came to meet some old friends and they wanted to do lunch at 11am. 11am?!? That's breakfast for me! We ended up staying and chatting until 3pm! Glad it wasn't busy or our poor waitress would have lost out on an additional one or two more tips.  I usually order the Fish and Chips or Jack Daniels ribs.Today, since it was so early for me to eat, I tried something different and had the French Ham -something- sandwich with a side salad. I have nothing bad to say about it. It was very flavorful and had a decent amount of meat in it. Plus it was about 1/3 of the calories of the very tempting Pulled Pork sandwich (they indicate calories now next to all their entrees). As someone previously mentioned, the booths are a little odd. I don't know why the table is almost at mid-chest level. Feels weird eating with your elbows sticking out so far.  Yes, I'd come back here again as I have on many occassions. I felt a little bad that we were there so long. I should have thrown down a couple of extra bucks for a tip. Oh well, I'll make it up to someone else down the line.

Date of visit: 10/13/2013 Not that Friday's is fine dining... let's face it if you're there on a Sunday night at 10pm it's because it's happy hour not because you're looking for service or food quality.  That being said, with low expectations Friday's fell WAY short on this visit. Friendly service & awesome happy hour all day on sundays!! $2.50 beer and $4 any wine you want.

Horrible service, our waiter Jeff only had 3 tables to serve n he could not keep up. Oner of the customers had to get up n look for him to get service. The food not worth our money. Chicken was super dry, the only thing I enjoy was the coke n the company I was with. Needless to say I will never come here again. Came here on a Friday night with Karl A. and it was super busy! Never come 10 minutes before HH ends thinking you're going to get a seat at the bar. There was a 40 minute wait for a table but we opted for the self seating bar area. TGIF offers a lot of deals, so hop on that. We split the Spinach flat bread and a Jack Daniel's burger. Don't forget the extra JD sauce!

Lunch specials aren't bad, but the food is soooo slow coming out of the kitchen.  Was there at 2 p.m., and the place was nearly empty.  So if you have nothing else to do and nowhere to be at any specific time, try it.

Man what horrible service & food we had today. 1st off our server sucked!!! The kitchen was slow. Once they served our food it was cold. My hamburger tasted like s^%$. I felt bad for my dad paying for the bill. I got it next time pops!! Just not here

Customer service was great. Broccoli was so over cooked it was moosh, my bfs steak was over cooked, we let them know but said he would still eat it. And our loaded mashed potatos didn't have chives... The food was a huge disappointment and now I'll never return there... But awesome servers and what not

Been coming here after work for dinner and drinks for quite a while now. Bartenders are always friendly and on point.  Kim turned me on to my new fave- fireball and angry Orchard! And they always make good suggestions and you gotta love happy prices. Really confused by the terrible reviews :(

Our order was taken when the drinks were dropped at our table. Our food arrived within about 10-15 minutes after that. I have never had faster service at TGIfridays than we did tonight. Happy Hour is the way to go. Oh yeah, we ordered dessert as well. 100% be back.

went there for dinner and left not to happy. I tasted the cocktail at the table and immediately sent it back to the bar! Our food took about 50 minutes to get to our table, by that time my 2 year old son was going crazy for food. The meals themselves - not impressive. Very sloppy and the taste did not fit the price we were paying. I do not think we will go back again. * we did have a mannerly waiter

OK, this place didn't cut it well enough to be a go-to for sports-related gatherings, so I've stayed away for some time, but football's back so we decided to give it another shot. Worst food we had in a while. Used sliced cheese in my chicken sizzle and served my daughter soupy fetuccini noodles. Won't be back anytime soon!

The staff is very friendly here, my wife and I ordered some green bean fries and dipped the in the sauce they give you. they where pretty good but half way thru my pulled pork i was running to the bathroom. that was fun.
